meanings.definition: A heavy, brownish grease used for rustproofing metal objects.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic applied cosmoline to the metal parts to prevent rust.
meanings.sent2: The old rifle was covered in cosmoline to protect it from corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got into the cosmoline jar and left greasy paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The cosmoline acted like a shield, guarding the metal from the harsh elements.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cosmoline lingered in the workshop, a reminder of the preserved tools.

meanings.definition: To coat or protect with cosmoline.
meanings.sent1: The workers will cosmoline the newly manufactured machinery before shipping.
meanings.sent2: It is important to cosmoline the exposed metal surfaces to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it would be funny to cosmoline the doorknobs, causing a slippery situation.
meanings.sent4: She cosmolined her skin with lotion, creating a barrier against the cold wind.
meanings.sent5: The soldiers cosmolined their weapons, ensuring they would function properly in any weather.
